se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.test.mbeanserver

Class LocalMBeanServerRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.TestWatcher
      • se.jguru.nazgul.core.jmx.test.mbeanserver.LocalMBeanServerRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    public class LocalMBeanServerRule
extends org.junit.rules.TestWatcher
    jUnit rule implementation to manage a local (i.e. in-process) MBeanServer during a Test Case. This has significance for all tests requiring a local and controllable MBean server.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocalMBeanServerRule()
      Default constructor creating a new LocalMBeanServerRule which unregisters all beans in its TestDomain after the test completes (i.e. in the finished() method of this class).
      LocalMBeanServerRule(boolean unregisterAllBeansInTestDomain)
      Compound constructor creating a new LocalMBeanServerRule which performs automatic de-registration of all beans in the test JMX domain.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void finished(org.junit.runner.Description description)
      Calls mBeanServer.unregisterMBean(objectName); for each MBean whose objectName starts with the jmxBeanTestDomain string - which normally is the same as the fully qualified class name of the test class being executed.
      <T> T getAttribute(ObjectName objectName, String attributeName)
      Retrieves the value of the attribute with the supplied name from the given ObjectName.
      SortedSet<String> getDomains() 
      String getJmxBeanTestDomain()
      Override to provide a JMX domain other than the default test domain.
      MBeanServer getMBeanServer()
      Retrieves the active MBeanServer from this Rule.
      Set<ObjectInstance> getMBeansInDomain(String jmxDomain)
      Retrieves all ObjectInstances within the JMX domain supplied.
      <T> T getMXBeanProxy(ObjectName objectName, Class<T> interfaceType)
      Retrieves an MBean proxy with the supplied interface type from the local MBeanServer.
      Set<ObjectName> getNamesInDomain(String jmxDomain)
      Retrieves all ObjectNames within the JMX domain supplied.
      void setJmxBeanTestDomain(String jmxBeanTestDomain)
      Assigns the JMX bean test domain, which is a domain where test code is applied.
      protected void starting(org.junit.runner.Description description)
      Starts a local/in-process MBeanServer, and validates that the JMX test domain is empty (i.e. not registered as a domain in the JMX server when the test starts).

        apply, failed, skipped, skipped, succeeded

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalMBeanServerRule

        public LocalMBeanServerRule()
        Default constructor creating a new LocalMBeanServerRule which unregisters all beans in its TestDomain after the test completes (i.e. in the finished() method of this class).

      • LocalMBeanServerRule

        public LocalMBeanServerRule(boolean unregisterAllBeansInTestDomain)
        Compound constructor creating a new LocalMBeanServerRule which performs automatic de-registration of all beans in the test JMX domain.
        Parameters:
        unregisterAllBeansInTestDomain - If true, all beans in the test JMX domain are unregistered when the test finishes.
        See Also:
        finished(Description)

    • Method Detail

      • starting

        protected void starting(org.junit.runner.Description description)

        Starts a local/in-process MBeanServer, and validates that the JMX test domain is empty (i.e. not registered as a domain in the JMX server when the test starts). The test domain is identical to the class name of the test class:

         
     // Stash the name of the test JMX domain.
     setJmxBeanTestDomain(description.getClassName());
        Overrides:
        starting in class org.junit.rules.TestWatcher
        See Also:
        getJmxBeanTestDomain(), setJmxBeanTestDomain(String)

      • finished

        protected void finished(org.junit.runner.Description description)
        Calls mBeanServer.unregisterMBean(objectName); for each MBean whose objectName starts with the jmxBeanTestDomain string - which normally is the same as the fully qualified class name of the test class being executed.
        Overrides:
        finished in class org.junit.rules.TestWatcher
        Throws:
        MBeanServerUnregisterException - if the LocalMBeanServerRule was instructed to unregister all beans in the test domain and was unable to do so.

      • getJmxBeanTestDomain

        public String getJmxBeanTestDomain()
        Override to provide a JMX domain other than the default test domain.
        Returns:
        getClass().getPackage().getName(), unless overridden in subclasses.

      • setJmxBeanTestDomain

        public void setJmxBeanTestDomain(String jmxBeanTestDomain)
        Assigns the JMX bean test domain, which is a domain where test code is applied. The JMX bean test domain is normally empty at the start of the unit.
        Parameters:
        jmxBeanTestDomain - The JMX bean test domain to assign to the local MBeanServer.

      • getDomains

        public SortedSet<String> getDomains()
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable SortedSet containing the domains currently registered within the MBean server.

      • getAttribute

        public final <T> T getAttribute(ObjectName objectName,
                                String attributeName)
        Retrieves the value of the attribute with the supplied name from the given ObjectName.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the JMX attribute requested.
        Parameters:
        objectName - The objectName of the MBean whose readable attribute should be retrieved.
        attributeName - The name of the attribute. Note! The attribute should be capitalized, implying that a JavaBean getter String getFoo() implies an attributeName "Foo" (not "foo"), according to the JMX specification.
        Returns:
        The value of the attribute in the supplied objectName.

      • getMXBeanProxy

        public final <T> T getMXBeanProxy(ObjectName objectName,
                                  Class<T> interfaceType)
        Retrieves an MBean proxy with the supplied interface type from the local MBeanServer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The interface type to retrieve.
        Parameters:
        objectName - The objectName of the MBean which must implement the supplied interfaceType.
        interfaceType - The interface type which should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        An MBean proxy implementing the supplied interfaceType.

      • getMBeansInDomain

        public Set<ObjectInstance> getMBeansInDomain(String jmxDomain)
        Retrieves all ObjectInstances within the JMX domain supplied.
        Parameters:
        jmxDomain - a name of a JMX domain. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a Set containing all ObjectInstances (i.e. MBeans) within the supplied JMX domain.

      • getNamesInDomain

        public Set<ObjectName> getNamesInDomain(String jmxDomain)
        Retrieves all ObjectNames within the JMX domain supplied.
        Parameters:
        jmxDomain - a name of a JMX domain. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a Set containing all ObjectNames within the supplied JMX domain.

      • getMBeanServer

        public MBeanServer getMBeanServer()
        Retrieves the active MBeanServer from this Rule. Normally, this
        Returns:
        the active MBeanServer from this Rule.
